title: Johnson scheme
summary: In mathematics, the Johnson scheme, named after Selmer M. Johnson, is also known as the triangular association scheme. It consists of the set of all binary vectors X of length ℓ and weight n, such that v = | X | = ( ℓ n ) {\displaystyle v=\left|X\right|={\binom {\ell }{n}}} .[1][2][3]  Two vectors x, y ∈ X are called ith associates if dist(x, y) = 2i for i = 0, 1, ..., n.
